com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin

Class SequenceAnnotationGenerator.SelectionGrabOption

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.Options.Option<Interval,JButton>
      • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.SequenceAnnotationGenerator.SelectionGrabOption
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    XMLSerializable
    Enclosing class:
    SequenceAnnotationGenerator

    public static class SequenceAnnotationGenerator.SelectionGrabOption
extends Options.Option<Interval,JButton>
    If any option returned from SequenceAnnotationGenerator.getOptions(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.AnnotatedPluginDocument[], com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.SequenceAnnotationGenerator.SelectionRange) is a SelectionGrabOption then the sequence viewer will interact with the option such that when the user clicks on the button representing this option, the current selection in the sequence viewer is copied to this option value. The getOptions implemenation should add a change listener to the SelectionGrabOption and update the values of other option values as appropriate.

    For example, the getOptions implementation may have a code fragment such as this: 

         final IntegerOption rangeMin = addIntegerOption("rangeMin", "Min", 1);
     final IntegerOption rangeMax = addIntegerOption("rangeMax", "Max", maxSequenceLength);
     final SequenceAnnotationGenerator.SelectionGrabOption selectionGrabber = addCustomOption(new SequenceAnnotationGenerator.SelectionGrabOption("selectionGrabber",new Interval(1,maxSequenceLength)));
     excludeRangeGrabber.addChangeListener(new SimpleListener() {
         public void objectChanged() {
             rangeMin.setValue(selectionGrabber.getValue().getMin());
             rangeMax.setValue(selectionGrabber.getValue().getMax());
         }
     });
    A SelectionGrabOption is invisible by default so that it does not show up when Options are displayed in a non-sequence viewer environment. The Sequence Viewer will set the SelectionGrabOption as visible when displaying the options.

      • getValueFromString

        public Interval getValueFromString(String value)
        Description copied from class: Options.Option
        Convert a String into an instance of the object type used by this option. This method should generally create a new object every time it is invoked. Only disregard this advice if you know what you are doing - e.g. it is safe to maintain an object pool and return the same object more than once if your Option's ValueType is immutable.

        This method is the inverse of Options.Option.getValueAsString(Object) .

        Specified by:
        getValueFromString in class Options.Option<Interval,JButton>
        Parameters:
        value - the string representation of the object value
        Returns:
        the object value or the default value if the string representation is not valid.

      • createComponent

        protected JButton createComponent()
        Description copied from class: Options.Option
        Create a graphical component representing this option. The implementation is responsible for making sure that the returned component is initialised to the current value of Options.Option.getValue(). The implementation is also responsible for making sure that the returned component listens to any changes made to itself and reflects those changes in the value of this option using the Options.Option.setValue(Object) method. This method will only be called once for each instance of an Option. After it has been called, getComponent() will return a cached copy of it.
        Specified by:
        createComponent in class Options.Option<Interval,JButton>
        Returns:
        a graphical component representing this option. May not be null.

      • addActionListener

        public void addActionListener(ActionListener actionListener)
        Adds a listener to be notified when the button has been clicked on. Typically this method is only used by the Sequence Viewer. AnnotationGenerators should typically use Options.Option.addChangeListener(org.virion.jam.util.SimpleListener) to be notified when the value of this option has changed as a result of the sequence viewer setting the value.
        Parameters:
        actionListener - a listener to be notified when the button has been clicked.
